column2: The great [From.Founder.GetFullName] is known the world over for invading the Middle Kingdom and forcing the mighty eastern dragon to bend the knee.
[Root.GetTitledFirstName] will plunder militay secrets from the Middle Kingdom

The legendary blood of the great [target_kcc_dragonslayer.GetTitledName], who plundered military secrets from the Middle Kingdom, runs through my veins. These strategies have been passed down the family line ever since, and now I finally have a chance to put those ideas into practice- but what technique should I use?
The lessons of the great general Sun Tzu remain applicable even today, more than a millenium after the man's death. I should look to him for inspiration when developing my own strategies.
The forces I command will strike with the might & fury of a dragon!
Tactics may win battles, but logistics wins wars.
I will attack where the enemy is unprepared, & appear where I am not expected.
Beating enemy armies is meaningless if we cannot breach their walls.
Master an aspect of Chinese Tactics
[Root.GetFirstName] follows a religion capable of preaching in the [offmap_china.GetName]
Only rulers of missionary religions can preach in China, including reformed pagan faiths with proselytizing.
All rulers may preach in China regardless of religion, unless they are Taoist or an unreformed pagan.
